intro: Carmichaelia kirkii, commonly known as the Stewart Island kowhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in coastal and lowland areas, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Carmichaelia kirkii plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators.
